DOCNAME: CASE OF BENKŐ AND SOÓSNÉ BENKŐ v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Egidijus Kūris;Guido Raimondi;Helen Keller;Jon Fridrik Kjølbro;Nebojša Vučinić;Paul Lemmens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE she brought an action before the GPE XX / XXI / XXIII ORG , seeking the dissolution of common ownership .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , acting as a second instance court , adopted a partial judgment in the case .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to the applicant ’s petition for review , ORG quashed the partial judgment on DATE and remitted the case to the first instance court .
CARDINAL . The case was terminated by ORG on DATE ( service : DATE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer posted a first communication to the ORG , indicating an intention to lodge an application and giving some indication of the nature of the application . The communication was dated DATE .
